terms.definition: A regular worker who uses the Vacation Tool primarily to view their vacation balance and submit vacation requests. Employees are the starting point of the vacation workflow and depend on the system to replace paper-based request processes.
terms.source_quote: "Employee", "role": "Regular employee / vacation requester"

terms.definition: A people manager responsible for reviewing and deciding on vacation requests from their team members. Managers provide the authoritative approval or denial that drives visibility for employees and triggers HR processing.
related_terms: Manager Calendar View with Pending Requests
terms.source_quote: "Manager", "role": "People manager / approver"

terms.definition: The Human Resources role that processes only manager-approved vacation requests, adds internal notes, and marks them as processed. HR relies on the tool to receive clear, finalized decisions and avoid manual reconciliation with other systems.
related_terms: HR Processing Area for Approved Requests
terms.source_quote: "HR", "role": "Human Resources processor"

terms.definition: The system administrator who configures the company setup, manages users and roles, and controls integrations such as national holiday imports. The Admin ensures the Vacation Tool is correctly set up so other roles can perform their vacation-related tasks.
related_terms: Admin Configuration for Users and Roles
Admin Integration Controls for National Holidays
terms.source_quote: "Admin", "role": "System administrator / company configuration owner"

terms.definition: Any person who logs into the Vacation Tool, including Employees, Managers, HR, and Admins, each with specific permissions. Users authenticate with credentials defined by the Admin so the system can control who sees and does what.
terms.source_quote: "Represents a system user (employee, manager, HR, admin) with login credentials and role assignments."

terms.definition: A defined set of permissions (Employee, Manager, HR, Admin) that determines what a user can see and do in the Vacation Tool. Roles enable a clear separation of responsibilities and protect sensitive information such as team balances and HR processing notes.
terms.source_quote: "Core user roles for v1 are Employee, Manager, HR, and Admin; all are employees with different permissions."

terms.definition: The main screen for Employees that shows their remaining vacation days and an interactive calendar with holidays and teammates’ vacations. This dashboard is where employees understand their availability and initiate new vacation requests.
related_terms: Display of National Holidays in Calendars
terms.source_quote: "Employee-facing dashboard showing remaining vacation days and an interactive calendar with national holidays and teammates’ vacations; supports selecting dates for new requests."

terms.term: Manager Calendar View with Pending Requests
terms.definition: A calendar view for Managers that shows their team members’ vacations and highlights pending requests. It helps managers make informed approval decisions by seeing overlapping absences in context.
related_terms: Pending Request Visualization and Tentative Balance Adjustment
terms.source_quote: "Manager view of calendar showing team members’ vacations and highlighting pending requests differently."

terms.definition: A formal request submitted by an employee to take time off for specific dates, which passes through submission, approval/denial, and HR processing states. It is the central business object that connects employees, managers, HR, and the external vacation-balance system.
related_terms: HR Processing Area for Approved Requests
terms.source_quote: "VacationRequest", "description": "Represents a vacation request from an employee with lifecycle state."

terms.definition: The system record that stores all data for a single vacation request, including dates, employee, status (pending, approved, denied, processed), and audit information. It enables tracking, visualization, and integration with external balance systems.
terms.source_quote: "VacationRequest", "description": "Represents a vacation request from an employee with lifecycle state."

terms.definition: A national holiday imported from an external system and displayed on calendars so vacation planning can avoid conflicts with non-working days. Holidays improve accuracy of scheduling and visibility across employees and managers.
related_terms: Admin Integration Controls for National Holidays
Display of National Holidays in Calendars
terms.source_quote: "Holiday", "description": "Imported national holiday from external system."

terms.definition: A logical grouping of users used to decide whose vacations are visible to each other in the calendar views. Teams structure the visibility and approval relationships in the Vacation Tool.
terms.source_quote: "Team", "description": "Logical grouping of users used to define 'teammates' whose vacations are visible to each other (exact model TBD)."

terms.definition: The link between a user and a team that determines which teammates’ vacations that user can see. It underpins the ‘team’ concept for visibility without exposing all company-wide data.
terms.source_quote: "TeamMembership", "description": "Association between Users and Teams used for teammate visibility."

terms.definition: Configuration data that stores endpoints, credentials, and options for external systems such as vacation-balance and holiday APIs. It allows Admins to manage integrations without changing the core application logic.
related_terms: Admin Integration Controls for National Holidays
terms.source_quote: "IntegrationConfig", "description": "Configuration metadata for external integrations such as endpoints and authentication details."

terms.definition: A record of key actions such as vacation submission, approval, denial, and processing. The audit log supports traceability and helps resolve disputes about who did what and when.
related_terms: HR Processing Area for Approved Requests
terms.source_quote: "AuditLog", "description": "Log of key actions such as request submission, approval, denial, and processing (model TBD)."

terms.definition: The process in which an employee selects from/to dates for a vacation, and the system checks remaining days and minimum notice before allowing submission. This ensures only feasible, rule-compliant requests enter the workflow.
terms.source_quote: "Employees select from/to dates; system validates sufficient remaining days via external system and enforces two-week minimum notice before allowing submission."

terms.term: Pending Request Visualization and Tentative Balance Adjustment
terms.definition: The behavior where submitted but not yet approved vacation days appear as pending on the calendar and are tentatively subtracted from the employee’s balance. This gives all parties a realistic view of upcoming absences while still indicating that they are not final.
related_terms: Manager Calendar View with Pending Requests
terms.source_quote: "After submission, requested days are tentatively subtracted and shown as pending on the calendar with distinct visuals until approved or denied."

terms.definition: The step where managers review pending vacation requests listed with key details and take approve or deny actions that are final from a business decision standpoint. This workflow is the authoritative gate between employee intent and HR processing.
related_terms: HR Processing Area for Approved Requests
terms.source_quote: "Dedicated manager menu/tab listing pending requests with key details and approve/deny actions. Manager decisions are authoritative and cannot be overridden by HR."

terms.term: HR Processing Area for Approved Requests
terms.definition: A dedicated HR workspace that shows only manager-approved vacation requests, where HR can add internal notes and mark them as processed. It simplifies HR work by filtering out unapproved items and clarifying the final step in the flow.
terms.source_quote: "HR-specific tab showing only manager-approved requests, where HR can add internal notes and mark as processed."

terms.term: Admin Configuration for Users and Roles
terms.definition: The admin interface used to create, update, and delete users, assign roles, and set core user details like vacation days and credentials. It centralizes ownership of user setup so that permissions and balances start from a reliable baseline.
terms.source_quote: "Admin tab to add/delete users, assign roles, specify user details (name, role, vacation days), and update credentials."

terms.term: Admin Integration Controls for National Holidays
terms.definition: The admin tools that load national holidays from an external API by selecting a year and importing JSON. These controls keep holiday data current without manual entry and ensure calendars reflect official non-working days.
related_terms: Display of National Holidays in Calendars
terms.source_quote: "Admin UI to load national holidays from an external API by selecting a year and importing JSON."

terms.definition: The login mechanism where users enter an admin-defined username and password, and the system grants permissions based on their role. This protects the application and ensures that each user sees only the information relevant to their responsibilities.
related_terms: Admin Configuration for Users and Roles
terms.source_quote: "Simple login mechanism with username/password defined by admin and role assignments (Employee, Manager, HR, Admin) determining permissions."

terms.definition: An API-based connection to a separate system that stores official vacation balances, used to read remaining days and deduct approved time off. This integration makes the external system the source of truth while still providing a smooth user experience in Vacation Tool.
related_terms: Blocking Behavior on External System Downtime
terms.source_quote: "API-based integration to read remaining vacation days and deduct approved days when requests are finalized."

terms.term: Blocking Behavior on External System Downtime
terms.definition: The rule that if the external vacation-balance system cannot be reached, the Vacation Tool must prevent actions like submissions, approvals, or deductions that depend on it and instead show a clear error. This protects alignment between systems by avoiding changes that cannot be recorded externally.
terms.source_quote: "Detect unreachability of external vacation-balance system and block submission, approvals, or deductions that depend on it, showing a clear error instead of proceeding."

terms.term: Display of National Holidays in Calendars
terms.definition: The feature that shows imported national holidays directly on employee and manager calendars. This visual context helps avoid planning vacations on days that are already public holidays.
related_terms: Admin Integration Controls for National Holidays
terms.source_quote: "Imported national holidays displayed on employee and manager calendars."

terms.definition: The ability for employees to see their teammates’ scheduled vacations on their own calendar. This transparency helps teams coordinate absences and avoid understaffing periods.
related_terms: Manager Calendar View with Pending Requests
terms.source_quote: "Employees can see teammates’ vacation days on their calendar; definition of 'team' to be clarified."

terms.definition: The strict rule that all vacation requests must be submitted at least two weeks before the start date, enforced automatically at submission time. This prevents last-minute requests and gives managers and HR predictable lead time.
terms.source_quote: "Enforce a rule that all vacation requests must be submitted at least two weeks before the start date."

terms.definition: The provisional subtraction of requested vacation days from an employee’s remaining balance immediately after submission, before manager approval. It shows employees and managers a more realistic remaining balance while keeping the deduction reversible.
related_terms: Pending Request Visualization and Tentative Balance Adjustment
terms.source_quote: "Upon submitting a request, the requested days are tentatively subtracted from the employee’s remaining balance and shown as not finalized until approved."

terms.definition: The security model in which the system shows and allows actions based on the user’s role, such as managers seeing team balances or HR seeing only approved requests. It ensures sensitive information is only available to the right audiences.
related_terms: Manager-Only View of Team Vacation Balances
terms.source_quote: "Role-based access control is enforced so that managers see team balances, HR sees approved requests, and admins see and do everything."

terms.term: Manager-Only View of Team Vacation Balances
terms.definition: A restricted view where only managers can see the remaining vacation days for each employee under their responsibility. This supports informed approval decisions without exposing balances to the entire organization.
terms.source_quote: "Manager-exclusive area listing employees under their responsibility with each person’s remaining vacation days (read via external system)."

terms.definition: The final operational step where HR handles manager-approved requests, adds any internal notes, and marks them as processed, often coordinating with payroll or other internal systems. HR processing confirms that a request has been fully completed from an administrative perspective.
related_terms: HR Processing Area for Approved Requests
terms.source_quote: "HR-specific tab showing only manager-approved requests, where HR can add internal notes and mark as processed."

terms.definition: The process of loading official holiday data for a given year from an external API into the Vacation Tool as JSON. This import keeps calendars accurate without manual data entry and is triggered by an Admin action.
related_terms: Admin Integration Controls for National Holidays
terms.source_quote: "National holidays and initial yearly holiday data are imported from an external system as JSON via an API, triggered by an admin-controlled 'load year' action."

terms.definition: The overall end-to-end vacation process where an employee submits a request, a manager approves or denies it, and HR then processes approved requests. This linear flow reduces confusion and ensures everyone understands the sequence of responsibilities.
terms.source_quote: "Simple, robust flow and permissions follow: employee submits → manager approves/denies → HR processes."
